unnormalised: The Delhi High Court on 20/07/2024 issued a notice to the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) regarding the ongoing dispute over property tax assessments for the financial year 2022-23. The case, filed by Mr. R.K. Sharma, alleges discrepancies in the calculation of the tax, citing a violation of Section 113 of the Delhi Municipal Corporation Act, 1957. The next hearing is scheduled for 15/08/2024.
normalised: The Delhi High Court on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four issued a notice to the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (M-C-D) regarding the ongoing dispute over property tax assessments for the financial year two thousand and twenty two to two thousand and twenty three. The case, filed by Mister R.K. Sharma, alleges discrepancies in the calculation of the tax, citing a violation of Section one hundred and thirteen of the Delhi Municipal Corporation Act, one thousand nine hundred and fifty seven. The next hearing is scheduled for fifteenth August two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Advocate Priya Verma, representing Mr. Sharma, argued that the MCD's assessment was based on outdated circle rates and failed to account for the property's actual condition, leading to an inflated tax demand of Rs. 50,000. The petition seeks a reassessment of the property tax liability and a stay on the recovery of the disputed amount until the matter is resolved.
normalised: Advocate Priya Verma, representing Mister Sharma, argued that the M-C-D's assessment was based on outdated circle rates and failed to account for the property's actual condition, leading to an inflated tax demand of rupee fifty thousand. The petition seeks a reassessment of the property tax liability and a stay on the recovery of the disputed amount until the matter is resolved.

unnormalised: The court has directed the MCD to file a detailed response within 4 weeks, addressing the allegations of procedural lapses and providing justification for the tax assessment. Legal experts anticipate that the outcome of this case could set a precedent for similar property tax disputes across the city.
